subject: RE: [junit] assert failure without exiting test.
msgSnippet: Thanks everyone for all your insightful responses.  I played with all the various solutions and I think the following was the cleanest way to solve the problem
messageBody:
Thanks everyone for all your insightful responses. I
played with all the various solutions and I think the
following was the cleanest way to solve the problem
(IMHO of course). Once again Thank you all for
responding.

Kent




--- Ilja Preuss <preuss@...> wrote:
> javayang@... wrote:
> > Howdy folks,
> >
> > I have a test method that iteratres through a
> String array performing
> > assert checks. The problem I have is on the first
> failure, the tests
> > discontinues and the rest of the array is not
> checked. This makes
> > sense because of the exception that is thrown and
> handled by JUNIT.
> > Is there a away I can keep the loop running until
> it finishes all the
> > strings. I can catch the exception but how do I
> add it to the
> > current aggregate test results that JUNIT is
> keeping track of. Also,
> > is this the best way or proper way to do this? I
> don't think it
> > makes very much sense to write a test method for
> each string in the
> > arry, it wouldn't be very scalable or dynamic.
> Thanks in advance for
> > any help or advice.
>
> I think you could write a test *suite* for this.
> Perhaps something along
> the lines of
>
> public class FooTest extends TestCase {
>
> public FooTest(int testValue) {
> this.testValue = testValue;
> }
>
> public void testBar() {
> assertEquals(..., myFoo.bar(testValue));
> }
>
> public static Test suite() {
> TestSuite suite = new TestSuite();
> for ...
> suite.addTest(new FooTest(i));
> }
> return suite;
> }
> }
>
> ???
>
> Take care, Ilja
>
>
